title: The handling of dangerous goods in Switzerland

author: Rudolf Dieterle, Swiss Federal Roads Office

segmentation: Let me open this event today, not in Swiss time.
Unfortunately, in Greek time, since some of us are still in breakfast.
But of course this happens when you have a meeting in a hotel.
On behalf of all the projects represented, especially Garrison, Good Root.
Good morning, we.
So today the ICT for transport, logistics or research projects event and I would like to start with a very distinguished guest and speaker.
I would like to invite invite to start this big event.

Under his response in building auspices of all the Swiss motorways.

Administration of our office.
The federal wrote office and then.
Those few words about the implementation of ADR 2007.

You see, we have.
A very large Rd transport.
In relation of tonnes, about 300 million tons each year on the road and about 60,000,000 tons of goods on the rail.
But if you look at the distances, you'll see the differences are much smaller, about 40 billion Tom Kilometers on the road, and nearly 10 count kilometers on that rate.
So long distance transports are in Switzerland, mostly on the rail, and the short ones average about 50 kilometers.
Wrote.
If you look in particular of the dangerous goods.
We have about 20,000,000 tons under Rd at about 9 million tons of dangerous goods under rail.

Rate is even.
Stronger.

Swiss economy.

Of this event and people are very, very afraid of risk.
In this field.

Is very, very low and people expected everybody that everything that's possible or models that are possible are taken to avoid those risks.
In reality.
We don't have so many accidents with dangerous goods.
If you compare the volumes we have, we don't have.
So many risk accidents.
Obviously.
Despite the fact that the release of dangerous goods on the road is a statistically rare event, as I showed you, the general public has a high level of aversion to risk of this kind.
And so we have to take care.
Of these feelings of our people.
And as fast as social political task is concerned, even through the statiscal risk is low, it is sufficient.
If the public perceived risk to be very high.
And our task.
Is to do appropriate legislation?
What are the measures?
At the feet of measures where we can improve safety.
First appointment of dangerous good officers in companies that transport dangerous goods.
Training certificates for carriers of dangerous goods.
Constructions regulations.
For bakers and containers used to transport for dangerous goods.
Of course, periodical checks by the authoritie's.
Transport regulations we have additional restrictions and prohibitions for the carriage of dangerous goods.
On certain stretches, stretches of Rd.
And we have a lot of roadside checks on the carriage of dangerous goods.
We have restrictions on the couch of dangerous goods in cars.
That's a very important field for us.
We have a lot of tunnels and we have.
15 Actually we have 50 tunnels.
Have been imposed additional.
Restrictions.
Done.

We have certain stretches of Rd.
With bands of carriage of dangerous goats especially.
Where we have.
Near protected lakes and.
Labels.
We have a lot of checks on carriage of dangerous goods by Rd.

About 1400 objects.
At quite a lot of offenses, 555.
Not only by 4.
People.
Also, uh, quite a lot of them by Swiss transporters.

With markings.

Other enforcement tasks are delegated or in the responsibility of the accountants.
My office has two.

And do some publications on our homepage.

All areas of the law relating to the carriage of dangerous code by rote.
We have to treat with special cases.
Hardship cases.
To do applications.
About 20 exceptional authorizations are granted and the main areas for that are training licenses for drivers, and.
The current test with regards to tanks.
Then we have to collect data concerning checks of dangerous goods.
We have it own database created in cooperation with the Counter Santa Customs Department.
It works since the 1st January of this year.

And this database contents is the scale of the carriage of dangerous goods, tons or ton kilometers, number of checks carried out, number of acres checked, number of offenses established and instructed measures.
We have to do the reporting.
The contents report to us.
And then we have to report directly to the EU to your patient European Commission every year, you know.
Work that days.
Then of course we have network responsibility.
For ensuring availability of connecting at roots and associated supply of dangerous goods.

On our route where they have.
Speed.

Works for legislative sustainability.
